intro: Echites hookeri, commonly known as the hooker's echites, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native region.
